isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase - Install - Vibration Damper

note.para: Make sure front mounting bracket is mounted to engine before installing vibration damper.

step1.para:
Mark rubber vibration damper with 100 °C (212 °F) Thermo-melt Crayon
.
Apply heat, attach Damper Heater (ZTSE4384) to vibration damper or place damper directly on hot plate.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use heat protecting gloves to install heated vibration damper.

caution.para: To avoid possible engine damage, do not install rubber vibration damper when it is cold (room temperature).

step1.para: When crayon mark melts, install rubber vibration damper on crankshaft nose with welding or heavy insulated gloves. Make sure keyway on damper aligns with key on crankshaft.

figure.caption: Heat vibration damper with Damper Heater
Heat vibration damper on hot plate

caution.para: To avoid possible engine damage, install the viscous vibration damper pulley and the viscous vibration damper separately. Mechanical persuasion will damage the viscous vibration damper.

note.para: Make sure front mounting bracket is mounted to engine before installing vibration damper.

step1.para:
Mark viscous vibration damper pulley with 100 °C (212 °F) Thermo-melt Crayon
.
Apply heat, attach Damper Heater (ZTSE4384) to viscous vibration damper pulley.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use heat protecting gloves to install heated viscous vibration damper pulley.

caution.para: To avoid possible engine damage, do not install viscous vibration damper pulley when it is cold (room temperature).

step1.para: When crayon mark melts, install damper pulley on crankshaft nose with welding or heavy insulated gloves. Make sure keyway on pulley aligns with key on crankshaft.
Install viscous vibration damper to damper pulley. Install six mounting bolts to " Special Torque ."

note.para: A damper retainer kit is available with grade 12.9 damper bolts and thicker damper retaining plate.

step1.para: Install 2.54 mm (0.10 inch) thick damper retaining plate.
Prevent crankshaft from turning, tighten damper bolts in sequence, continue until " Special Torque " is reached with no movement of any of the bolts.
